experience sampling methods.reasoning: Experience sampling methods are a specific data collection technique that involves gathering data from participants in real-time about their feelings and experiences throughout the day, which is essential for examining the effects of affect balance on well-being.
passages: We use experience sampling methods and polynomial regression to test the notion that daily PA and NA at work, along with their interactive and nonlinear effects, predict employee well-being after work.

polynomial regression.reasoning: Polynomial regression is a statistical analysis technique used to model the relationship between variables, in this case, to analyze how daily PA and NA, along with their interactions, predict well-being outcomes.
passages: We use experience sampling methods and polynomial regression to test the notion that daily PA and NA at work, along with their interactive and nonlinear effects, predict employee well-being after work.
